attributes.action: Award the humanitarian medal to frontline personnel that served in the pandemic
attributes.additional_details: Hundered of thousands of lives were saved by the efforts of the front line services during the pandemic. Thus-far no government has recognised, acknowledged or even thanked any of the frontline services for the efforts and sacrifices made. The Labour government being the party of compassion should award this medal as a sign of thanks and acknowledgment.
attributes.background: The government should recognise the efforts and sacrifices made by members of the NHS, emergency services, armed forces, carers and any other front line workers that served during the COVID pandemic. The government should award all personnel with the humanitarian medal.

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions that ask for a person or a group of people to be given an honour, or have an honour taken away.
